(68436, 70395).description: The Southern Hemisphere, one of the two hemispheres of the Earth, extending from the equator to the South Pole

(68436, 70395).name: NH
(68436, 70395).label: location
(68436, 70395).description: The Northern Hemisphere, one of the two hemispheres of the Earth, extending from the equator to the North Pole

(68436, 70395).name: TOA ERF
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: The top-of-atmosphere effective radiative forcing, a measure of the change in the balance between the amount of energy absorbed by the Earth and the amount of energy emitted back into space

(68436, 70395).name: atmospheric ERF
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: The effective radiative forcing of the atmosphere, a measure of the change in the balance between the amount of energy absorbed by the atmosphere and the amount of energy emitted back into space

(68436, 70395).name: global precipitation
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: The total amount of precipitation that falls on the Earth's surface, an important component of the global water cycle

(68436, 70395).name: CMIP5 models
(68436, 70395).label: model
(68436, 70395).description: The Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 models, a set of climate models used to simulate and predict the behavior of the Earth's climate system

(68436, 70395).name: climate feedbacks
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: Processes that can either amplify or dampen the response of the climate system to a given forcing, such as changes in cloud cover or ocean currents

(68436, 70395).name: clouds
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: Visible masses of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere, which play a crucial role in regulating the Earth's energy balance

(68436, 70395).name: CO2
(68436, 70395).label: variable
(68436, 70395).description: Carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas that contributes to global warming

(68436, 70395).name: RCP4.5
(68436, 70395).label: experiment
(68436, 70395).description: A representative concentration pathway scenario that assumes a moderate increase in greenhouse gas emissions and a peak in radiative forcing by 2100

(68436, 70395).name: RCP8.5
(68436, 70395).label: experiment
(68436, 70395).description: A representative concentration pathway scenario that assumes a high increase in greenhouse gas emissions and a continued rise in radiative forcing throughout the 21st century

(68436, 70395).name: RCP2.6
(68436, 70395).label: experiment
(68436, 70395).description: A representative concentration pathway scenario that assumes a low increase in greenhouse gas emissions and a peak in radiative forcing by 2050

(68436, 70395).name: ACCESS
(68436, 70395).label: model
(68436, 70395).description: The Australian Community Climate and Earth-System Simulator, a climate model used to simulate and predict the behavior of the Earth's climate system
